title: A plane defect in the 3d O$(N)$ model

last_post.content: Today's #arXivsummary: https://arxiv.org/abs/2301.05728 by Krishnan & Metlitski. Authors extend the idea of an "extraordinary-log" boundary universality class to the 3D O(N) model in infinite geometry with a plane defect. Extraordinary-log universality class is present for any finite N≥2; evidence that, at N=Nc, the extraordinary and special fixed points annihilate and only the ordinary fixed point is left for N>N. #CondMat #StrEl #arXiv_2301_05728

Excited that this is out in the world!

title: Shaking the foundations: delusions in sequence models for interaction and control

last_post.content:
If you are learning from a sequence of observations and actions, and using a probabilistic model, you should be treating the agent's actions as #causal interventions. The authors attribute the lack of causal interventions as the reason for #delusions, and also propose a way to do #MetaLearning. #MachineLearning #Causality #ReinforcementLearning

https://arxiv.org/abs/2110.10819

title: Richest 1% bag nearly twice as much wealth as the rest of the world put together over the past two years | Oxfam International

last_post.content:
Extraordinary even when compared to trends during the past two decades of rising #inequality.

“During the pandemic and cost-of-living crisis years since 2020, $26 trillion (63 percent) of all new wealth was captured by the richest 1 percent, while $16 trillion (37 percent) went to the rest of the world put together. A billionaire gained roughly $1.7 million for every $1 of new global wealth earned by a person in the bottom 90 percent.”

Sometimes you remember some nice factoid, but become unsure if it actually is something embellished or outright false.

title: Linking impulsivity to activity levels in pre-supplementary motor area during sequential gambling

last_post.content:
Thread about new paper: People with lower impulsive personality traits take fewer risks in a gambling task. But how does the brain translate a stable trait into momentary decisions? Apparently the preSMA is a core player: perturbing it with TMS decouples trait and state impulsivity.

This we show in our new paper by Allan Lohse and @dav_meder at the @DRCMR: “Linking impulsivity to activity levels in pre-supplementary motor area during sequential gambling.” https://www.jneurosci.org/content/early/2023/01/11/JNEUROSCI.1287-22.2023

While scanning participants with fMRI, they played a gambling task where they repeatedly throw a die and accumulate points, until they stop and bank their winnings or until throwing a 1 which leads to the loss of the accumulated points.

#newpaper #paperThread #researchpaper #neuroscience #neuro #fmri #tms #JNeurosci

Using #CSS `:is()` in the tail of complex selectors selects more elements than you might initially think.

This is because selector matching in browsers happens from right to left.

For example, `.a .b .c` and `.a :is(.b .c)` might look the same, but they’re not. The second selector will also match the `.c` in:

```html
<div class="b">
<div class="a">
<div class="c"></div>
</div>
</div>
```

Full details in https://brm.us/css-is-matching

title: The Case of the Golden Idol

last_post.content:
If you liked Return of the Obra Dinn, and especially if you were into it but it was maybe a little too much detective work for you to keep track of, I highly highly recommend The Case of the Golden Idol. It's a detective game where you investigate crime scenes and try to reconstruct what happened, similar to Obra Dinn's filling out of the ship manifest through inference. But the puzzles are a little smaller scope, and it's all 2D. It is SO GOOD.

https://www.thegoldenidol.com/

Part II: Computational Approaches to Culture." Surprised that there aren't too many TBAs. You may find a few things of interest:

a) The final paper will be co-written with AI.
b) There's a midterm exam whose sole purpose in life is to use it as a tool to build vocab and understanding.
